result.rationale: This species is restricted to the upper part of the Caroní River with an extent of occurrence (EOO) of 2,502 km<sup>2</sup>. There is a high level of threat related to illegal mining. There is a single location based on this threat, which is leading to a continuing decline in habitat. Therefore, this species is assessed as Endangered.
result.geographicrange: This species is restricted to the upper part of the Caroní river sub-basin (middle Uruyén river) in the Orinoco Basin (Fernández-Yépez 1967, Lasso et al. 2004).
result.population: No information is available on the population.
result.habitat: It occurs in black water rivers of Venezuelan Guiana (upper Caroní, Uruyén River), with rocky bottom, very fast waters and strong current (C. Lasso pers. obs.).
result.threats: Threats include mining in the middle Uruyén river, which results in deforestation, riverbed alteration, sedimentation, contamination by heavy metals, and spills of gasoline, oil and human sewage (Hitcher 2020, SOS-Orinoco 2020).
result.conservationmeasures: Site protection and management are recommended, as well as research into the population size and trend, and its distribution.
